turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Oh, shit! He got me.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Joey's getting stupid busy.

turns.speaker: NIKON
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: We did it!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Here's your class.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: My... class. You mean I'm not in your class?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No, you're not in my class.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah, there's an Olympic size swimming pool up on the roof. Take the stairs over there.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah! Sure.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: That's a nice score for a girl.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Think you can do better?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I'll give it a shot.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What the hell is going on?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Pool on the roof must have a leak.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He's not in this class.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I said give me time.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He's not enrolled in this class.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Burn. You're Acid Burn. You booted me out of OTV!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I'm Crash Override.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You're the moron that's been invading my turf?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: It's cool, I'm just looking.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It's too much machine for you.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: It has a killer refresh rate.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: P6 chip. Triple the speed of the Pentium.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah. It's not just the chip, it has a PCI bus. But you knew that.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Indeed. RISC architecture is gonna change everything.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah. RISC is good.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: You sure this sweet machine's not going to waste?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Crash Override. What was it. "Mess with the Best, Die Like the Rest?"

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Are you challenging me?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Name your stakes.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: If I win, you become my slave.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Your slave?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You wish. You'll do shit work, scan, crack copyrights, whatever I want.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: And if I win?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Make it my first born.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Make it our first date.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You're not gonna win.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: And you have to smile.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I don't do dates. But I don't lose either, so you're on.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: We need your help.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Do my ears deceive me?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What is it with you? I know we've been playing games, but, we're supposed to be on the same side and we really need your help. I really need your help.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I'm sorry, I can't.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well, could you just make a copy of the disc? And just hide it in case we get busted, so we have something to give our lawyers, something that hasn't been tampered with? Can you do that?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Okay. I'll copy it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Okay, thank you.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Kate, listen.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Uh, hold on...

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I have to tell you something.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: This is every financial transaction Ellingson conducts, yeah? From million dollar deals to the ten bucks some guy pays for gas.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: The worm eats a few cents from each transaction.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: And no one's caught it because the money isn't really gone. It's just data being shifted around.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Right. And when the worm's ready, it zips out with the money and erases its tracks.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Joey got cut off before he got to that part. Check it out. By this point, it's already running at, what, twice the speed as when it started.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Right, and at this rate it ends its run in...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Whoever wrote this needs somebody to take the fall. And that's Phreak, and that's Joey, and that's us. We've got to get the rest of the file, so we can find out where the money is going before the worm disappears, so we can find out WHO created it.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I know, I know who wrote it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: This Ellingson security creep. I gave him a copy of the disc you gave me.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I didn't know what was on it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Why did he come to you?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I got a record. I was Zero Cool.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well that's great. There goes MIT.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I'll make it up to you!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I'll hack the Gibson.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Shit!!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It's my subway defense system.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Alright, so what have we got?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Well, we have fifty passwords, plus whatever Polaroid head here got inside Ellingson.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: There they are!

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Razor and Blade! They're flakes!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: They're elite! Let's get 'em.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: A virus called Da Vinci will cause oil spills at 10:30 AM Eastern Time tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: It's somehow connected with the worm that's stealing the money.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: We need your help to overload the Gibson so we can kill the Da Vinci virus and download the worm program.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Alright, let's boot up.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: It's the Gibson, it's finding us too fast.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Man, there's too many garbage files, I need more time.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Are you crazy? What are you doing?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: I'm trying to help you.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Dade.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Thanks for your help.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Oh, wow, she's great.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: You look good in a dress.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You would have looked better.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Wanna go for a swim?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I can't believe they decided you won.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: They didn't. The guys felt it was the only way I'd get a date. Anyway, you're pretty good. You're elite.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah? You know if you would have said so in the beginning, you would have saved yourself a whole lot of trouble.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: You know, I've been having these really weird..

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Dreams?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Security, uh Norm, Norm speaking.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Norman? This is Mr. Eddie Vedder, from Accounting. I just had a power surge here at home that wiped out a file I was working on. Listen, I'm in big trouble, do you know anything about computers?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Uhhmmm... uh gee, uh...

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Right, well my BLT drive on my computer just went AWOL, and I've got this big project due tomorrow for Mr. Kawasaki, and if I don't get it in, he's gonna ask me to commit Hari Kari...

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Uhhh.. ahahaha...

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah, well, you know these Japanese management techniques.  Could you, uh, read me the number on the modem?

turns.speaker: NORM
turns.text: Uhhhmm...

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: It's a little boxy thing, Norm, with switches on it... lets my computer talk to the one there...

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: Yo, chill man, I'm talking to Venezuela.

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Yeah, I'm sorry, I was just looking for the principal's office.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: Sorry, I can't help you, okay?

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: So, um, what's your interest in Kate Libby, eh? Academic? Purely sexual?

turns.speaker: DADE
turns.text: Homicidal?

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: What's up, man? I'm the Phreak!

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Did you find the program for the virus on any of the discs we confiscated?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: No. He's either very smart or very stupid.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Then he stashed it somewhere, or he has an accomplice. We'll release him until his indictment, keep tight surveillance, and see if he leads us to your disc.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Gill.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: I think we've got something.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: It got you seven years probation. No computer, couldn't even use a touch tone phone.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Must have been hell, huh? Zero Cool?  A virus has been planted in the Ellingson Mineral computer system. You were our prime suspect, till we trashed your stuff and found no trace of it.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: However, we have come to believe that one Joey Pardella is involved in this Ellingson virus. He or perhaps his accomplice has a disk that Mr. Belford needs to disable that virus. We want you to help us find it.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Gill.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: We caught 'em.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: Red handed! You won't be having any more trouble from them.

turns.speaker: GILL
turns.text: You're welcome.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: What's going on? Let go of me! Stewardess! I'll never fly this airline again!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: There's a new virus in the database.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: What's happening?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: It's replicating, eating up memory. What do I do?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: A rabbit replicates till it overloads a file, then it spreads like cancer.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Cancer?

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Colonel who?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: The System Command Processor, it's the brain.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Cancer, brain... Brain Cancer?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Mr. Belford?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: My name is the Plague.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Uh, Mr. The Plague, uh, something weird's happening on the net.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: As in what, you hapless techno-weenie?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Uh, the accounting subdirectory in the Gibson is working really hard. We got one person online, the workload is enough for like ten users. I think we've got a hacker.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Never fear. I is here.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I've narrowed the activity to terminal 23.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Let's echo 23, see what's up.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: We have a Zero Bug attacking all the login and overlay files.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Run anti-virus. Give me a systems display!

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Die, dickweeds!

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: The rabbit is in the administration system.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Phreakphreakphreakphreakphreak, dudedudedudedudedudedude... I gotta...

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Joey, Joey...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What? whatwhatwhat?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: One more "dude" out of you and I'm gonna slap the shit outa you, okay? Now I'm trying to save you from yourself but you gotta stop letting your mama dress you, man! : Check it...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I need a handle, man. I don't have an identity until I have a handle.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: You know, you're right about that.  Check it, Friday.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Alright. How about the Master of Disaster, huh?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: You're hopeless, man, utterly hopeless.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Anyways, guys, guys, listen, listen to me. I'm in this computer right? So I'm looking around...

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: D'you bring those Crayola books?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You guys always think I should know everything, and you never tell me anything. Am I right?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Alright, what are the three most commonly used passwords?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Love, secret, and uh, sex.  But not in that order, necessarily, right?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Yo, what's up?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Dude dude dude, I gotta talk to you a minute, listen listen listen. I copied a garbage file from...

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Big deal. A garbage file's got shit in it, Joey, come on.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Nono, it's like hot or something. I don't know.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Joey, a garbage file holds miscellaneous data. Junk. Bits of stuff that's been erased, man.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I copied it from Ellingson, okay? They're asking me about it, alright? Will you take a look for me?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Hey! What are you guys doing in here?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: I'm sorry, we're sorry, just checking out your fly laptop!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What is he doing in here?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Relax, Burn, he's my guest.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Any questions?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah. Whose gonna notify his next of kin?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Hey, it's me.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Phreak?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: I'm freaking! Joey wasn't making it up! He really hacked into Ellingson! He gave me the disc with a file he copied and now I'm in jail! They're charging me with some serious shit! And there's stuff I didn't even do, like inserting some virus called Da Vinci, and they keep asking about you guys.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You think they're going to bust us?

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Yeah! You better figure out what's on that disc, cause we're being framed. It's in that place where I put that thing that time?

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Good morning, Gentlemen. Please be seated. I see we're still dressing in the dark, Eugene.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Once again, don't call me Eugene.  A recent unknown intruder penetrated, using a superuser acount, giving him access to our whole system.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Precisely what you're paid to prevent.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Someone didn't bother reading my carefully prepared memo on commonly used passwords. Now, as I so meticulously pointed out, the for most used passwords are love,  sex, secret and...  ...God. So would your holiness care to change her password?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: A hacker planted the virus.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Virus?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Yesterday, the ballast program for a supertanker training model mistakenly thought the vessel was empty, and flooded its tanks.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: The little boat flipped over. A virus planted in the Gibson computer system claimed responsibility.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: What, it left a note?

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: So what are we supposed to do?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Well luckily, you have a gifted and talented security officer. I traced the hacker's call. The secret service picked him up this morning. I'll just search his files for the original virus code, and then I can eliminate it.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: What the hell was that all about?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: I had to move fast. The hacker copied my garbage file.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: I created Mister da Vinci so we could call in the Secret Service. So they'd arrest the hacker, sieze his equipment, things that we can't do on our own.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: I don't want to go to jail for this.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Relax. Think about the 25 million dollars.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: But you've created a virus that's going to cause a worldwide ecological disaster, just to arrest some hacker kid?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Basically, uhmm, yeah. Mmm hmmm.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Jesus. You know, you're sick, Eugene. You...

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Sh, sh sh sh sh.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Murphy kid turn you down?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: I disguised myself as an Alabama State Trooper and penetrated the FBI NCIC.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Pervert! What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: The FBI computer holds files on twenty million Americans.  I just hacked into it.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: From here I got access to every piece of data ever stored on Dade Murphy's parents. His parents separated five years ago, reconciled two years later, filed for divorce last year, custody battle, boy chose to go with his mother. Hmm.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: So, we get the mother, we get the boy.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: They had a large chunk of the garbage file? How much do they know?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Not everything. But enough to implicate us.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: You said the worm was untreaceable!

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Yeah. To civilians. But they're hackers. But don't worry. All we have to do is launch the Da Vinci virus, and then they'll all be put away.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Launch the Da Vinci virus? You can't do that!

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: No one believes the guilty. Besides, by the time they realize the truth, we'll be long gone with all of our money.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: What is it? What's wrong?

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Nothing, it's just a minor glitch.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: "Minor glitch" with you seems to turn into a major catastrophe.

turns.speaker: PLAGUE
turns.text: Send a Flu-shot.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Rabbit, Flu-shot, someone talk to me.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Nonono, thank YOU!

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: Hello, operator services.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Hello, operator? I'm having trouble dialing a number.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: What number please?

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: Just one moment.

turns.speaker: PHREAK
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: Purpose of visit?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: A patient pickup and transfer to Smith's Grove.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yeah.  Should be on the road.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: Yeah, ha, hell of a night huh?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Real charmer.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: I'll take you down there.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Rachel! What are you doing here? I thought I was supposed to pick you up?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Jamie needs a Halloween costume.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: You do? Okay. Go down aisle A. We've got the best costumes in the whole town.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: We need to talk.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Okay sure. What about?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Its about tonight.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: My parents baby-sitter canceled.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: So I have to watch Jamie tonight.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: When did you find this out?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: This morning.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Well you found out this morning? Why didn't you tell me before? I mean it's 5 o'clock now Rachel...shit

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Don't get angry.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: I'm not angry it's just

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Can I come over after Jamie's asleep?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: My parents are going to come home early tonight.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I don't know Brady.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Okay, I guess. I'll call you later.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Rachel, I've got an expl-- I've got an explanation.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You don't owe me anything.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Just leave me alone and lets forget it.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: No, you don't understand.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: I mean, you blew off our date at last minute.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: So you hop on to the next best thing? I thought you were different from other guys.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: I am different, it's just that I just got pissed off...that's all.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Oh really? Well, I'll just let you get back to little Ms. Hot panties.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Are you two okay?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: We've been better.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Michael Myers.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: 10 years ago? Halloween? He's Jamie's uncle.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: No, no, we have to get out of here right now.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Not without Jamie.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Look.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: You think she stands a chance?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: She's not dead!

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Is there another key?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I don't know!

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Its metal, god dammit its metal.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: We're trapped in this house.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Brady!

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Get back!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Brady!

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: No. You son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Brady! Come with us.

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Go!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Brady!

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Get up there Rachel!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Brady!

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Get up there Rachel!

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Brady! Come with us! Brady!

turns.speaker: BRADY
turns.text: Go!

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: When did this happen?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Sometime in the night. They probably lost the road in the storm. Come down the embankment. It happens.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: An accident?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: It's hard to tell, there all chewed up.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: Loomis, it's over. Leave it alone.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: I've seen bodies thrown 50-60 feet from a crash site.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: Look, even if by some miracle Michael is conscience, his muscles would be totally useless.  Give the troopers a chance to search.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Hang on Mrs. Pierce.  Not that tie, on the other side.  That's not the only thing your eating Rachel.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Mom, I'm on a diet. You want an oinker for a daughter?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Mom, please

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: You'll have to watch Jamie tonight.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Not tonight. I've got that date with Brady. You know how important that is.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Well tonight is very important for your father and me.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: Can't you find somebody else?

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Its too late.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: What am I supposed to tell Brady? Sorry, but I've got to baby-sit my foster sister, go and have fun by yourself.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Its not exactly the end of the world, for goodness sake

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: How do we look?

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: You guys always look great.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: We'll be at the Fallbrooks. The number's next to the phone.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I know, and next to that is the police, hospital, fire, and probably National Guard.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Oh dear God. Its all right...a bad dream, just a nasty old dream.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: It's okay..it's okay.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Clean one in the laundry room next to your blue slacks.  Hello?

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Honey, this tie has a spot on it, I can't wear this today. I got a 10:30 with Chuck.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Found it.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Sorry. Do you suppose Susan could just bring her crutches? Oh, stupid question. Tell her I hope  she feels better.  Susan's mother, she can't baby-sit tonight.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Susan broke her ankle last night at the ice rink  Rachel?

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Honey, I don't think their home.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: How do you know their not?

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Because the lights are all out.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I told them to be here by nine. Its not 9:30 yet.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: We should call the fire department.

turns.speaker: RICHARD
turns.text: I'm not calling the fire department.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Why wasn't I notified?

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: You know damn well about what.  You let them take it out of here.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: For Christ sakes. Spare me the speech. I've listened to it for a decade.  The fact is that Michael Myers was a federal patient, and a federal prisoner therefore he is subject to federal law.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: We're not talking about any ordinary prisoner Hoffman! We are talking about evil on two legs.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: I can see this is useless.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: I don't want to have anyone live through that night again.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: I've said this before. I think your the one who needs medical help.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: Why shouldn't I?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: How many people in the bus?

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: Four plus Myers.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: How many bodies did you find?

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: Now where are you going?

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Haddonfield. It's a four hour drive. You can reach me through the local police. If you didn't find him in four hours, I'm sure I will.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: I'm Dr. Hoffman, Medical Administrator.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Has he been prepped?

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: Ready to go.  Who signs for him?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: Outside.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Check him out.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'd assumed Dr. Loomis would be here.  Michael Myers was his patient.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: If Loomis read memos he's be here. Fortunately his position is more ceremonial then medical. My hope is that he's either transfer, retire, or die.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Watch it.

turns.speaker: DR. HOFFMAN
turns.text: I can safely say that Michael Myers is now in your hands.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yeah.  Well I guess your happy to see him go.
